title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3ยง 2.8 - Hearing officer's report
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3ยง 2.8 - Hearing officer's report

State Regulations
(a) If the evidence has been taken before a hearing officer, he shall, after
considering the briefs and proposed findings that may have been filed with him
and any oral argument that may have been made before him, make and file a
report with the Banking Board, and shall thereupon serve a copy of such report
on the respondent and on the superintendent. Such report shall contain: (1)
recommended findings of fact, together
with the page numbers of the transcript supporting those findings; (2)
recommended conclusions of law; (3)
any statement as to the credibility of
witnesses that the hearing officer may deem desirable. (b) Together with his report, the hearing
officer shall file with the Banking Board the entire record of the proceedings
before him, including the transcript, any exhibits, and the briefs and proposed
findings of the parties, if any were filed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3ยง
2.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
